prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top** **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] **Step 2: Define the 2D sketch** Define a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. **Step 3: Draw the curves for the 2D sketch** Draw the following curves to complete the 2D sketch: - Three lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3): - line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.75] - line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] **Step 4: Create loops and faces** Create a loop (loop\\_1) with three lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3). Since the loop is closed by default, no additional action is needed. The face (face\\_1) is automatically created by the loop (loop\\_1) and covers the entire area enclosed by the loop. **Step 5: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. **Step 6: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with a depth of 0.75 toward the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal. **Step 7: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The final shape is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. The dimensions are as follows: - Length: ~0.75 - Width: ~0.75 - Height: ~0.75</description>

The loop consists of: * 10 line segments **Step 3: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Scale the sketch by the provided sketch scale factor of 0.75. Rotate the sketch using the Euler angles. Translate the sketch using the given translation vector. **Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.075 units, creating a new solid body. This part has the following dimensions: - length: 0.75 - width: 0.075 - height: 0.75 Follow this format for creating each intermediate part and the final CAD shape. The instructions provided here only contain necessary steps and do not include any additional assumptions.</description>

This closed loop consists of 12 lines with a total of 12 vertices. The length and width of the prism are 0.75 and 0.0833, respectively. Next, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75, transform it into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system, and extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model of this part. Note that this part will be used to construct the final model with a "JoinFeatureOperation".</description>
